course.subject: COMP
course.name: Advanced Topics in 2D and 3D Deep Visual Scene Understanding
course.description: Visual scene understanding is an important and fundamental field for advanced application scenarios such as autonomous driving and robotics. This course majorly focuses on delivering deep learning-based visual scene understanding techniques in both 2D and 3D perspectives. In the 2D part, it introduces topics including image and scene classification, semantic segmentation, and object detection. In the 3D part, it shows how 3D scene understanding can be performed through learning from 2D inputs, involving topics such as scene depth estimation, camera pose prediction, 3D scene reconstruction, and visual SLAM. Several representative deep scene understanding architectures and frameworks in supervised or self-supervised settings together with the 2D/3D tasks are also presented in the course.

reviews.author: goNeptune
reviews.comment_content: This course has a lot of basic machine vision and machine learning knowledgeã€‚
reviews.comment_teaching: The lecturers are very capable and have their own insights and narrations for each different part. But it is too scattered, making the course too boring. At the same time, a large amount of time is spent on presentation by students, and it is difficult to guarantee the quality of teaching.
reviews.comment_grading: The TA gives the grade randomly. Every work in a group have the same grade, even they do the different work. Scores are given without any explanation and measurement criteria.

reviews.author: khleeloo
reviews.title: Interesting Content and Good Teaching
reviews.comment_content: The content is very interesting, the lectures are intertwined with student presentations (those might be good or bad depending on the individual). But the content prepared by the professor is clear and well structured.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor knows how to present the content well. His presentations are clear and interesting which is important since the course is offered at 9AM. Professor is very kind, professional and punctual.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is very generous since it's a course for PG students. Many of the students got an A. Project is the most important but presentation, attendance and being active are also considered. Since asking questions and presenting is an important part of the course, shy students may have some more problems (but it's a good opportunity for them to challenge themselves)
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is good. There is presentation, review and group project all announced in advance. Everything is well scheduled so there are no surprises, and it just requires good planning. No final exam is a plus.

reviews.author: Billy Schwartz
reviews.comment_content: This course is designed for RPGs, equipping new students with broad but in-depth knowledge of different topics in computer vision.
reviews.comment_teaching: Xu Dan's teaching is very good in this course. For each topic, he will give his own lecture before letting students addressing their own speeches. So in this way, he makes sure that we do not misunderstand the ideas in each paper.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is gracious, as far as I know, people woulc pass it with adequate B+.
reviews.comment_workload: Compared to normal courses designed for undergraduates and TPGs, the workload for such seminar courses is very low.

reviews.author: itruonghai
reviews.title: Good Course to Learn
reviews.comment_content: The course covers almost area in computer vision, from basic knowledge (Backpropagation, CNN) to more recent advanced topic and SOTA papers.
reviews.comment_teaching:
At the beginning of the course, Professor Dan XU will cover the most fundamental parts in computer vision, so that the student from different background can easily follow the course.
In the later part of the course, student have to present the paper review to the classes for discussion. However, some topics are not carefully prepared, so the discussion seems to be less effective
reviews.comment_grading:
Paper review 25%
In-class presentation and discussion 25%
Final project 50%

Both paper review and Final project are really important. You should prepare it carefully.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is light if you have a good final project direction.

reviews.author: JUGG
reviews.title: Not A Traditional Tutorial, More Like Academic Discussion
reviews.comment_content: This course covers a wide range of advanced topics in computer vision. However, for those with very little prior computer vision knowledge, it could be torturing as they might not be able to catch up with the teacher. For me, I am satisfied with the contents individually.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would like to defend Dr. Xu against some of the previous negative comments. Although students need to give in a fraction of the classes, such a form is common in routing seminars for RPGs and would benefit further research. Since computer vision itself is an applicational community, there might not be a lot of in-depth theoretical analysis, especially in the deep learning era. But still, Dr. Xu tried his best to cover as much as possible and engaged students in this course. However, I have to say that not all students prepared for the presentation well, leading to less effective discussion.
reviews.comment_grading: I do not know how some of the previous fellows come to the conclusion of "random grading". I feel like the grading is reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is a little bit much if the project is not appropriately scheduled. However, compared to some other courses, the workload is acceptable.

reviews.author: Hexiang WEI
reviews.comment_content: It contains almost all the dozen or so research problems in computer vision, such as: multi-task learning, slam, depth estimation, scene understanding, etc. Will introduce the basic knowledge of them and review the sota work.
reviews.comment_teaching: All were divided into groups of three corresponding to different research questions. Everyone needs to share a paper in the field, after the teacher has introduced the field.And complete a related project at the end of the term with a presentation
reviews.comment_grading: Easy to pass, But if you want to get good grades, you need good paper review and group work.
reviews.comment_workload:
1 paper review
1 paper share pre
1 group project

reviews.author: tansangxtt
reviews.comment_content: The lectures mix with presentions from students. There are some sub-topics related to Scene Understanding that will be introduced by the instructor, students need to select a paper from the list to present
reviews.comment_teaching: Can ask questions at any time, the way lecturer present likes sharing sessions that students also need to do in the course
reviews.comment_grading: I feel this part can make everyone attend this course relax as it's not quite hard to earn a good mark
reviews.comment_workload: It's flexible as you can discuss with the instructor to see whether it's fit your time or not, the instructor will give you some recommendation

reviews.author: kenshin
reviews.title: Not very nutritious, Giving Grades randomly
reviews.comment_content: Most of the class time students are doing pre, only a small part of   course time are about teaching.  The topics in computer vision are without going deeply, very shallow. The content is not very nutritious, sometimes boring.
reviews.comment_grading: The most disgusting  part is the TA gave grades randomly.
reviews.comment_workload: Too much pres work. Most of the couse time are spent on pre by students. Two course each week. But more than half of the time are about uesless pre. The teacher's work are easy, but for student it's too boring.
